reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that Brilliant collects personally identifiable information (Personal Information) when users access/use the service, including information users voluntarily submit and anonymous information automatically received when interacting with the service.
reply.reference: This Privacy Statement covers Brilliant's treatment of personally identifiable information ('Personal Information') that Brilliant gathers when you access/use the Service. Brilliant collects information you voluntarily submit to the Service, such as your name, email address, school, date of birth, etc. In addition, Brilliant may automatically receive and store certain anonymous types of information whenever you interact with the Service. URL: https://brilliant.org/privacy_policy/

employees in connection with our provision of services to customers, in which case we are the processor of Personal Data. reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects personal data such as first and last name, email address, birthdate, IP addresses, mailing address, telephone number, facts about education history and career, general location, device identifiers, web browser information, page view statistics, browsing history, usage information, transaction information, cookies, and other tracking technologies.

content: Facts about education history and career

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from the sections of the privacy policy that detail the personal data collected by the app, including information provided directly by users, automatically collected data, and data received from third parties.
reply.reference: See 'Information you elect to submit to the Service' and 'Information we automatically collect when you use our Sites' sections in the privacy policy. URL: https://brilliant.org/privacy_policy/

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that the app processes Personal Data for various purposes like creating and managing user profiles, providing support, personalizing website content, responding to user inquiries, fulfilling requests, resolving disputes, protecting against fraudulent actions, and enforcing Terms and Conditions.
reply.reference: We process Persona Data to operate, improve, understand and personalize our Sites. For example, we use Personal Data to: - Create and manage user profiles - Communicate with you about the Sites - Process orders - Contact you about Site announcements, updates or offers - Provide support and assistance for the Sites - Personalize website content and communications based on your preferences - Meet contract or legal obligations - Respond to user inquiries - Fulfill user requests - Comply with our legal or contractual obligations - Resolve disputes - Protect against or deter fraudulent, illegal or harmful actions - Enforce our Terms and Conditions. URL: https://brilliant.org/privacy_policy/

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, users can opt-out of data collection or delete data. Users have the right to request the erasure of their Personal Data from Brilliant's systems or withdraw their consent for data processing.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that users have the option to request the deletion of their personal data or withdraw consent for data processing, indicating that users can indeed opt-out of data collection or delete their data.
reply.reference: You can request that we erase some or all of your Personal Data from our systems. Withdrawal of Consent: If we are processing your Personal Data based on your consent - ... you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. URL: https://brilliant.org/privacy_policy/

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties as described in the Privacy Policy.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with various third parties for different purposes as outlined in the policy.
reply.reference: We share Personal Data with vendors, third party service providers and agents who work on our behalf and provide us with services related to the purposes described in this Privacy Policy or our Terms and Conditions. URL: https://brilliant.org/privacy_policy/

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with payment processors, ad networks, analytics service providers, services to provide customer support, hosting service providers, other users (for public posts or transactions), social media services, other parties authorized by the user, and third parties with user consent.

content: Other parties authorized by the user

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly lists the types of third parties with whom the app shares data, which provides a comprehensive overview of the entities involved.
reply.reference: The app shares data with third parties, including payment processors, ad networks, analytics service providers, services to provide customer support, hosting service providers, other users, social media services, other parties authorized by the user, and third parties with user consent. URL: https://brilliant.org/privacy_policy/
